messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: email trouble
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/23/2003 11:50:57 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... I also started getting my mail again today after speaking with AOL yesterday. Its nice to
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/23/2003 11:50:57 AM Eastern Standard Time,
HaHaMommy@... writes:

> >>today I seem to have all my mail (or at least a lot more than the
> past week!)<<
>

I also started getting my mail again today after speaking with AOL yesterday.

Its nice to feel "in touch" again. As a fairly new unschooler in a really
conservative
"school-at-home" homeschooling area, the support I feel from just reading
these e-mails and the message boards has been both enlightening and empowering.

I haven't posted much because I'm still in the reading, reading, reading
stage. I mostly continue to just be in awe of all the postive changes in my
children and our family since we embraced unschooling. There is so much wisdom as
well as some superb writing being shared by those of you who post on both this
discussion group and the message boards.

Just wanted to say Thanks!

Gail


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: email trouble
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10-23-2003 7:01:24 AM Mountain Daylight Time, amycats2@aol.com writes: . I sent a complaint to postmaster@aol.com. Haven t heard anything
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10-23-2003 7:01:24 AM Mountain Daylight Time,
amycats2@... writes:
. I sent a complaint to postmaster@.... Haven't heard anything back, of
course, but I think I'm getting all my mail now.
Amy Kagey
++++++++
I talked to the *live help* at AOL Tuesday nite. She thought it was my spam
block, but we checked and that's not it. A report was sent to the *powers
that be* and today I seem to have all my mail (or at least a lot more than the
past week!)

diana,
The wackiest widow westriver...
"You can follow your book and your map of wars, but I'll go and follow my
kids." -- Woody Guthrie


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] Re: email trouble
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/23/2003 6:59:34 AM Central Daylight Time, ... Yahoo said my ISP was rejecting Yahoo s emails. I sent a complaint to postmaster@aol.com.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/23/2003 6:59:34 AM Central Daylight Time,
CelticFrau@... writes:

> Amy - any luck yet? I thought it was OK, but then came here to the
> website and found a BUNCH of emails that never came to my email box.
> I'm so bummed!!! Who did you complain to? Are you sure it was AOL
> and not Yahoo?
>

Yahoo said my ISP was rejecting Yahoo's emails. I sent a complaint to
postmaster@.... Haven't heard anything back, of course, but I think I'm getting
all my mail now.
Amy Kagey

messages.subject: Re: email trouble
messages.msgSnippet: Nancy! you have a broken arm? yikes...my husband, too. Broke it at work a couple of weeks ago. But he has a brace that keeps his arm firmly at his side. His
messages.messageBody:
Nancy! you have a broken arm? yikes...my husband, too. Broke it at
work a couple of weeks ago. But he has a brace that keeps his arm
firmly at his side. His injury is not castable, being near the top of
his humerus.

Wish I lived in BC and could come bug ya!

hope it gets better

love, HeidiC


> It is very ironic, for me this list is what keeps me going
sometimes. We

nightly fix. Ooops,

> Nancy in BC, in for yet another 5 weeks in a cast with the
incredible

terribly isolated
> and starved for conversation. How is that for a run on sentence?
Getting silly
> now, must stop.

Nancy B. in WV

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] email trouble
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 22/10/2003 10:01:40 Pacific Daylight Time, ... It is very ironic, for me this list is what keeps me  going sometimes. We have only the two
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 22/10/2003 10:01:40 Pacific Daylight Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> his list is usually so busy that people take light days as system failure!
>
> And the most common reason people leave this list is too much e-mail.
>
> Ironic, isn't it? <g>
>
>

It is very ironic, for me this list is what keeps me going sometimes. We
have only the two families of unschoolers here, so I need my nightly fix. Ooops,
sounding like a zealot there. Would you call me a Doddite?<G>
Nancy in BC, in for yet another 5 weeks in a cast with the incredible
non-healing humerus that is not at all funny and causes me to be terribly isolated
and starved for conversation. How is that for a run on sentence? Getting silly
now, must stop.

Ironic, isn't it? <g>

Sandra
